title: I am annoyed at how worthless essence reaver is compared to the other 80 ad items...
body:
Currently essence reaver is supposed to solve mana problems for certain champions.

The problem is, mana is generally an early-mid game problem. Essence reaver's cost CLEARLY states that it is NOT an early-mid game item. And this just annoys me because essense reaver has potential to add some diversity to the incredibly boring ADC build path.

Even champions who seem to be able to use it have no reason to build it over other items.

{{champion:81}} Can use it, but he prefers to just rush tear because by the time he gets to grab an ER, mana problems are not that much of a problem anymore.

{{champion:236}} Can rush it, but most people prefer to rush {{item:3031}} because its just not as effective.

{{champion:91}} Talon could use it in the early game, but the problem is HE CAN'T GET IT IN THE EARLY GAME.

And there are plenty of more cases like this. 

There used to be something called "soul sickle" on PBE but Riot scrapped it. Why? I don't know. It was a nice item, can we please have it back Rito? My suggestion to make ER viable is:

 **Soul Sickle**  Builds out of 2 {{item:1036}}. 
Has 25 ad, 10% cdr, and a passive that grants 3%-5% of damage dealt as mana for every autoattack and single target ability.

{{item:3508}} **Essence reaver** Builds out of  Soul Sickle and {{item:1038}}.

Has 80 ad, 20% cdr, and a passive that grants 5%-8% of damage dealt as mana for every autoattack and single target ability.

Ok this MAAAY be going overboard but do you guys think essense reaver should be buffed in some way or left as it?

replies.body:
Essence Reaver happened *after* Riot got tired of the "Rush Chalice, never run out of mana" meta that every mage that didn't have mana ratios played.

That said, an item with 80 AD and 10% CDR is useful, particularly since it has both Lifesteal and Mana Vamp. It's *niche,* but it's useful. Like Manamune/Muramana, it helps a specific set of champions rather than being a universal tool.

The problem I have with it is that unlike manamune, it is technically an alternative to its two other "brothers". 

If you want damage, get IE. If you want defense, get BT. If you want utility, get ER. The problem is ER doesn't give enough utlity to warrant purchasing it over the other two on any situation unless you're {{champion:126}}...

Manamune on the other hand, fills its own special role and nothing can really replace it. It's why you see it being used A LOT more than Essence reaver.

> [{quoted}](name=Insanity 101,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OrcgeX3G,comment-id=000d0000,timestamp=2015-03-14T16:27:21.984+0000)
>
> The problem is ER doesn't give enough utility to warrant purchasing it over the other two on any situation unless you're {{champion:126}}...

Or Talon, or Graves, or Pantheon. I could also see Kha'zix using it.

While I will agree that it seems lackluster compared to IE (it's pretty much on par with BT; instead of 10% more lifesteal and a shield, you get 10% CDR and the mana vamp), it still fills a niche. And, to be honest, Infinity Edge suffers from an imbalance issue, thanks to Crit itself kind of being a huge, systemic problem.

Anyway, Essence Reaver fills a niche that players have requested for a while. It's not the best, most popular item in existence, but it certainly works when you need it.

I don't think its on par with BT. What is some mana and 10% cdr compared to a shield and 20% lifesteal unless you desperately want to reach the cdr cap? Especially considering that they are both lategame items?

Also Talon doesn't get ER. By the time he actually has space to get it mana is nothing to him as he just dives into teams and unloads everything. The only time he can use ER is in laning phase, when he can't even afford it.

Most Graves rush IE, the damage is way too valuable to give up for some mana.

Pantheon maybe, but he rushes black cleaver and by the time he finishes the ER, he is usually out of the laning phase (where he pokes a lot) and in the mid game. Mana at this point isn't a problem for him as he just dives. 

Kha'zix only gets it REALLY late in the game simply for the 10% cdr and ad.

As for ad caster adcs (which it seems to have been made for), it has no reasons to be built over items like triforce and manamune.

> [{quoted}](name=Insanity 101,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OrcgeX3G,comment-id=000d000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-14T17:22:52.862+0000)
>
> I don't think its on par with BT. What is some mana and 10% cdr compared to a shield and 20% lifesteal unless you desperately want to reach the cdr cap? Especially considering that they are both lategame items?

First, ER costs 300 gold less than BT.

Second, some champions would value 10% CDR over a shield that *might* increase effective max HP by 350, if you're given a chance to farm on something before a fight. Plus, most of the champions who would build Bloodthirster don't have enough Armor/MR to capitalize on that shield's effective HP bonus.

Third, mana vamp is helpful. Most champions don't need it, but there are those that do.
 
> Also Talon doesn't get ER. By the time he actually has space to get it mana is nothing to him as he just dives into teams and unloads everything. The only time he can use ER is in laning phase, when he can't even afford it.

Who said he picks it up for the mana vamp? Not that it doesn't help, considering how mana gated he is even in the mid-late game.

It's 80 AD and 10% CDR. By the time you can get it, *you get it because AD and CDR.*

Unless you're going with a Crit-build Talon, which would sub it for Infinity Edge anyway.
 
> Most Graves rush IE, the damage is way too valuable to give up for some mana.

Because he's only going to build one BF sword item in the game. /sarcastic eye roll

> Pantheon maybe, but he rushes black cleaver and by the time he finishes the ER, he is usually out of the laning phase (where he pokes a lot) and in the mid game. Mana at this point isn't a problem for him as he just dives. 

You seem to have this misconception; I'm not saying they buy it for the mana vamp. It's a useful bit that helps them all, but it's more the AD/CDR that really helps them.

> Kha'zix only gets it REALLY late in the game simply for the 10% cdr and ad.

Hence, "I could see Kha'zix buying it."

> As for ad caster adcs (which it seems to have been made for), it has no reasons to be built over items like triforce and manamune.

Over Trinity: because pure AD will be more useful than a Sheen proc (it *can* be on some of them).
Over Manamune: because it's instantly 80 AD instead of starting at 20 AD and taking more than 20 minutes to be 60 AD.

I don't think you get my point.

Essence reaver can be built later on as a niche item. But it cannot be a core item on anyone, which shows how weak it is. Manamune on the other hand, is a core item on several champions....
Why does it have to be core on anyone? ER is a fantastic item, and i really think you're under estimating cdr. And just because IE is broken doesn't mean ER is bad.

It's pretty much never more useful than Bloodthister.  20% lifesteal and the shield are ALWAYS more valuable than the Mana Sustain and 10% CDR ER gives.  Increase the CDR to 20%, and we can talk.

The build path could also use some QoL changes.  Make the recipe Pickaxe + Vamp Scepter + Forbidden Idol, and the item path is way better.

The problem is that it just isn't an efficient buy. Yes, cdr and lifesteal are nice, but they aren't worth committing to it instead of Infinity Edge or  bloodthirster or merc.... or often even maw.....

It just isn't powerful enough to compete with its competitors. 

If its cost went to 35 and its cdr went to 20%, I'd say it competes with the other 3 80 attack power items. But it doesnt now.
I am now an ADC main, and I agree that Essence Reaver is useless after early - mid game. The only person I would ever build it on is Sivir after Infinity Edge.

Well it can be fine on utility ADC since CDR is rather valuable on them... like Ashe (having her ult on a lower cooldown is a big deal)... and caster ADC.. well even they are usually better off getting something like IE even though they are so reliant on their abilities (and if they really wanted CDR they could get lucidity boots + IE.. as I think that would be better then beserker greaves + Essence Reaver)

A way to make ER viable without making it super overpowered would be to give it spellvamp since most champions who build it...use abilities, on top of 20% CDR and taking the cost down by like 200 gold.

It would be used for utility rather than damage, it would still have the 80 damage that most high costing AD items cost, but it wouldn't be total damage like Infinity Edge.

The reason why I don't recommend the total mana regeneration buff is because someone like Sivir will never run out of mana. As far as I know, her W works with the Essence Reaver so if she built it she might as well not have a mana bar. And on top of this, it's value if it was just buffed in mana regeneration would still make it irrelevant since it falls off late game.

Essence Reaver should be made as a true utility item for ADCs because at the moment the standard build is damage, damage, damage, attack speed, oh and damage and boots (Honestly I sell boots some times late game.)

Spellvamp wouldn't work how you want. Spellvamp gives a % back based on *magic / AP damage* not based on *using an ability*. So almost all ADC's would get nothing out of it ( {{champion:96}} {{champion:110}} {{champion:42}} have forms of *consistent* magic damage) the other ADC's either have a ratio on their ult (not consistent; and not fully ratio'ed) or scale strictly off of AD.

However, I'm sure {{champion:84}} would love extra  spellvamp. {{champion:24}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:78}} {{champion:10}} you get the point. You can't just make a heavy AD item, with heavy spellvamp, and not think that it will be better abused by hybrid champs.

It would be interesting as an item for hybrid champs (i think it would need more balancing), but in that form it wouldn't be used by ADC's. It just wouldn't have the spellvamp/sustain potential there. Lifesteal/Spellvamp item would go on hybrids along with a {{item:3146}}.

I'm not sure when you started playing, but they made {{item:3146}} passive spellvamp Unique **because** of these issues.

*Edit:* I'm assuming at least 10% spellvamp to keep it equal with the lifesteal. Really any less than that (5%?) just wouldn't even be worth it anyway.

This is wrong.
Spellvamp applies to all abilities that don't have on-hit effects, regardless of which type of damage they deal.

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Spell_vamp

*Spell vamp is a magical stat that converts a percentage of the ability damage dealt into health regained. Activated abilities that do not state they "apply on-hit effects" or modify your "next basic attack" will benefit from spell vamp.[1]*

Good Call! Just tested it out and that works. I wish they would call abilties (Q,W,E,R) skills or call AP something like Magic Damage ( so AD and MD) instead of Ability Power. That way it would be easier to define things that are affected by magic damage sources, physical damage sources, and skill damage sources.

The interaction makes sense as lifesteal works on physical/magical damage types, just is optimal on physical auto attackers and spellvamp works on both types but is optimal on those dealing heavy damage with skills (generally mages).

However, I still think that adding spellvamp, extra cooldowns, and a price point reduction would not make a better {{item:3508}} for ADC's, but would be stronger in the hands of old hybrids. I don't think it would really serve to diversify adc builds.

It used to be that attack damage would increase the power of your basic attacks, and ability power would increase the power of your abilities.  Even physical-damage ones.

But that was in the very beginning of the game (and I'm not even sure if it was a universal rule back then.)

Now, more and more abilities scale from attack damage (where the champion is AD based, and it doesn't make sense for them to build AP.)

But it still remains that AD and AP are two different skill scaling factors, which are used to boost skills on a skill-by-skill basis.
There's no direct relation between the scaling stat (AD / AP) and the damage type (physical / magical / true.)
Generally speaking, abilities that deal magic damage usually scale with AP, and ones that deal physical damage usually scale with AD, but there's no fixed rule.

There are quite a few skills that scale with both AD and AP, and deal one type of damage or the other.

I don't think it's really a problem with essence reaver, it's a problem with infinity edge.  As long as IE is as powerful as it is, any item *or* champion that doesn't synergize really well with crit is in a bad place.
They should open up more builds, but I think nerfing IE has to be the first step.

To an extent yes.. but even {{item:3072}}  is super popular.. I think this guys point is, many AD items are picked before it simply because they out class it in every way, even on champs that would benefit from a mana return on hit.

I haven't seen people rush {{item:3072}} this season.  You need {{item:3031}} and some member of the {{item:3086}} family because their raw damage output is so OP, then you need {{item:3035}} unless the enemy team is all squishies. I see people rush BT quite often, not that I agree with it.. but people do it. Its quite common on {{champion:119}} {{champion:15}} {{champion:429}} {{champion:222}}  as a first item. Like i said, i DONT 100% agree with it.. its just an observation from MY games.

also BT 2nd most built item.. and stays top 3 consistantly

IE was already nerfed.... I feel that incentivizing other build paths outside of crit would be a better solution.

"Riot why can't I have ungated early game poke to go along with broken sustain from ranged lifesteal? This is so unfair."

I'd prefer jayce and mana gated adcs not faceroll top lane any harder.

I suggested the lifesteal be removed from ER. :P

Tbh though, I think guys like Jayce will need some nerfing if soul sickle comes out.

Yarp.  Reaver is only viable on Ezreal when you are going CDR build and have 5% masteries, 15% boots, 10% IBG, 10% Reaver.  Then you tack in a LW and another blue item and buy the blue trinket and you have the most color coordinated ADC build.

{{item:1036}} + {{item:1004}} = Soul Sickle


Soul Sickle + {{item:1038}} = Essence Reaver

I use Essence reaver on {{champion:222}} a lot of the time. Why? Cause I should really never be out of Fishbones during team fights, but sadly I usually can only fishbones like 12 - 14 times before I run out of mana / Need to start saving mana for my Ult / Zap / Grenades.

With the current state of AD itemization, this is a troll build, because it has no crit and crit is too OP to pass up.

It is a cool idea and I wish it could work with people whose kit supported it, but it really can't right now.

This isn't a troll build.

* They only listed 2 items; if that's all they buy all game and keep 7k in their pocket, ok they are trolling by not buying anything
* They are using an item to make up for a weak spot in their playstyle
* {{champion:222}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3508}} {{item:3085}} {{item:3035}} {{item:3006}} 

This could potentially be the build and it doesn't look troll. It's just more focused on jinx's interaction with rockets & hurricane. So teamfights with massive splash damage. It's not the best single target build, but it's built towards cluttered teamfights.

Troll builds are when people used to build 6 boots, or going full ap on a champion with no ap ratio's. That's more trolling. The reaver / hurricane combo is just something you wouldn't do, and that's fine. You don't have to.

I think the bigger problem is the second point.

{{item:3508}} is generally used to help people with mana management; which is a playstyle issue. Learning how to manage mana can be learned outside of the games item system. You can selectively use abilities and just not spam as much. 

However, something like {{item:3031}}  gives you stats and a passive that you can't make up for outside of the item system.

You can't just learn to crit, you need items for it. You can learn to manage mana though.

I think {{item:3508}} reaver is interesting, as it does allow for a playstyle difference, but I think it needs something core to change to keep it's identity but make it competitive. I don't think giving it a stepping stone build path would really give it any more late game worth.

Well, I assumed they meant it as the *first* two items.  If those are your first two items then you're going to be reported for doing no damage in the midgame, and probably won't get the chance to reach full build unless your team is overall significantly stronger than the enemy team.

Maybe "troll" is too strong a term, it's not AP Garen, but it's definitely a build that makes you weaker than you should be for the amount of gold you spent on it.  And your teammates will not be happy with that.

If you build ER early, you're giving up too much damage to get too little in return.  If you build it late... why?  Most champions can't run out of mana late game.  Maybe {{champion:96}} ...

In practice, you'd probably build {{item:3031}} {{item:3046}} first for their crazy synergy, then {{item:3035}} if the enemy team has any tanks.  {{item:3085}} might or might not be a decent addition at that point, but you're already past where the mana from {{item:3508}} would make any difference to anything ever.  Might as well build {{item:3072}} instead, get more sustain and possibly the shield.

Oh, ah, hehe. Yeah, that would be a pretty bad build order! I thought they were just saying they like to build those on {{champion:222}} at some point! Yeah, usually when I see the term trolling I think of somebody doing something that they may get reported for. I more see buying items in the wrong order, but with non-trolly intent, as part of a learning curve. Like there is still more they need to learn about build paths and the game. I know I still have a lot to learn and wouldn't want to get reported just because I don't have the same experience / knowledge as some challenger dude.

* {{champion:222}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3035}}(if they are building armor) with {{item:3006}} snuck in there somewhere. Then build something depending on what I wanted. {{item:3072}} / {{item:3102}} / {{item:3026}} / {{item:3139}} as prolly the most common options. Honestly in some games {{item:3085}} isn't bad if the teams are just clumped up and you can get hurricane rocket crits off; melt teams that way **if** they stand on top of each other for some reason. Fight in choke points / around neutral objectives.

I do agree with you however, as an adc main that would be a build order for {{champion:222}}  that would make me cringe a little inside! :} Just gives up too many power spikes rushing those two!

Well, I agree with what you're saying, but did you notice that ER dropped out of your discussion completely?

It's not an item that you want to buy anywhere in your first 3 items because of the loss of damage/synergy with other early items, and after that, what is mana?  You're spending most of your time trying to waveclear/farm or occasionally hit turrets while staying out of assassin dive range, except for 5-10 seconds tops of actual fighting, which is followed by multiple people dying or backing.  And if you did win but oomed in the process, who cares, you don't need mana to take down a turret after the fight.

> Just gives up too many power spikes rushing those two!

I think that's exactly the issue.  If ER isn't a power spike itself, then people won't want to build it when they can build items that are.

imo it's biggest weakeness is it's build path.

It should have a smaller piece that grants the mana vamp passive + slight mana regen:

{{item:3114}} + {{item:1053}} = mana vamp item + {{item:1037}} = {{item:3508}}.

It's AD should be reduced to ~65 AD and give it more mana vamp lategame so the small item doesn't become an AD chalice.

Once upon a time (5/8/2012, to be precise), they released an ADC named Varus.  He's got a bow, and this cool cursed-with--awesome vibe, and he has some interesting theoretical AP or AS/hybrid build options, but in reality, his build option is "why did you pick Varus?  Did you misclick Vayne at the last second?"  He actually got a buff in the last patch, but we'll see whether or not the community at large cares.

Anyway, whenever I play Varus, I go for a full-AD build ("Legolas" Varus) to take advantage of the bonkers damage on his Q, but his Q's cost gets up to 90 at rank 5.  Since I want to A. have more mana to fire arrows and B. have more CDR to fire arrows, I rush Essence Reaver.  It works pretty well.  Sure, it'd be nice to have the perks of BT, but the 300 gold is actually relevant at that point, and 10% lifesteal is enough.

I don't know the ER itself should be buffed, but it should build out of something with mana vamp.  Of course, the problem with that is that a lot of champions would start the mana vamp component and ignore the rest: perhaps the mana vamp component builds out of Pickaxe and has terrible efficiency, but the combine cost is dirt-cheap for ER, to give an incentive to finish.

You could simply have the mana vamp be mediocre on the base item and let it be much better on ER (so if you are fine with a little life steal or mana vamp you can just sit on the item ER builds out of or the vamp scepter as it is perfectly fine just sitting on a vamp scepter)

The problem is that attack damage scales a lot, and mana costs scale a little bit or not at all.  A small amount of mana leech will still be sufficient with enough damage.  I'm not saying it can't work, but that's what I'd be worried about.
Hmm... well since it is supposed to be an early to mid game item... you could possibly give it a flat mana return on hit (maybe increased when you get lower on mana?)

Oh and about Varus... I just feel that he isn't compensated enough for his lack of mobility.. and his steroid (passive) is a bit weird and unreliable

And I think his ult could possibly be made so that it starts behind Varus and then travels around him and then as usual (to make it better at hitting people standing on top of Varus)

Why ADC no get Essence Reaver:

For a basic reference point, an adc build WITH inifinity edge does 1.5x to 2x more damage over time ON AVERAGE than a build without Infinity Edge at most stages of the game.  Reguardless of what item you swap for infinity edge, you are just going to do a stupidly higher amount of damage per second with it than without.  Thus, for lack of a better alternative or something even close, this item is irreplaceable.  It has gold efficiency akin to a fully stacked mejai's soulstealer as far as we are concerned.  That is how good it is.

Our build starts with {{item:3031}} as an adc.  Because we have this, taking a phantom dancer or a statikk shiv has stupidly high value.  Just irreplaceably high value.  You kind of really want to / need to take one of them because that's how good they are with infinity edge already in your build.  Let's assume we go with Dancer because it's a better single target item.

Our build now has {{item:3031}} {{item:3046}} .  We now need to build {{item:3035}} at some point.  So that's 3 item spots already gone.  (For the love of heaven never play adc without building Last Whisper.  The sheer power coming from this item is irreplaceable).  Our boots are going to take a 4th spot, because that's just what boots do.  Finally, we want to take a 5th, more defensive item that will let us withstand single champ burst (Guardian's Angel, Banshee's Veil, Mercurial Scimitar, etc).

So by this point in time, we have ONE spot left in our build.  One spot left to compete for.  And the other competitors are {{item:3087}}  or {{item:3046}} (whichever you didn't get), {{item:3153}} , and {{item:3072}}.  Reguardless of what you pick, the health shred, double the lifesteal, or the sheer extra damage per second is going to be more useful on an adc.  This is why they don't build Essence Reaver (Ezreal almost certainly should not).

ISTM that this mainly proves that {{item:3031}} {{item:3035}} are OP and crowding out other itemization paths.  For example {{item:3085}}, which doesn't synergize all that well with a heavy crit build, is hard to justify even on people whose kits really benefit from it {{champion:29}} {{champion:110}} {{champion:17}} (who has practically been pushed out of marksman altogether because too much of his stuff doesn't crit), unless what they get from it is completely gamebreaking untouchable kite for days {{champion:429}} .

So... I build essence reaver on {{champion:110}}. Damage for Q, mana for Q, CDR for Q.

Poke for days.

TBH you do not replace {{item:3004}} with {{item:3508}} in an ezreal build. You simply replace your lifesteal item of choice either {{item:3072}}  or {{item:3153}} with {{item:3508}} . Not only is the 10% CD more valuable than a shield for Ezreal who is primarily an AD Caster, the mana regen lets him spam Q for free and helps him regain mana used from {{item:3042}}. 

TLDR:  Ezreal still has some mana problems by using {{item:3042}} and {{item:3508}} helps with that issue. Additionally 10% CDR isnt a bad stat to trade for a shield + 10% lifesteal on certain champs.
